title: New Syndra PBE Nerfs/Buffs
body:
Force of Will (W) bonus changed to "Deals 20% bonus true damage." from"Grabs 2 additional spheres near the target."
Force of Will (W)
AP ratio lowered to 70% from 80%
Damage lowered to 70/110/150/190/230 from 80/120/160/200/240
Unleashed Power (R)
Cooldown increased to 120/100/80 from 100/90/80

W damage was overall buffed, for a removal of the previous passive making her a bit harder
R cd nerf? idk about this, it's a nerf overall.

replies.body:
Current thinking:

* Syndra's ult being on a lower than average CD early leaves insufficient windows to play against her, especially if she gets ahead in lane. Those windows of safety are particularly important on a champ with high and fairly reliable burst.
* The W upgrade arguably allows Syndra to get 7 sphere ults too consistently and without the telegraph and mana cost that keeping that number of spheres around would other wise entail. It also removes a skill test that some established Syndra players value.
* If removing the existing W passive we'll need another. The old one wasn't impactful or satisfying, so we don't want to go back to that. Shifting some damage to more target agnostic damage (True damage bonus) has some appeal because it doesn't increase overall damage in the most powerful cases (bursting down a squishy) as it does in the less optimal cases (hitting tanky opponents). 
* Overall power likely needs to come down.

Thus far the changes look promising. I'm a little suspect if the 20% true damage value will stay, but it's easy to adjust -- you can knock it down to 15% or 10% if it contributes too much on its own, for instance. Base damage hit skims some power off her laning phase, and the reversion of the AP ratio buff puts the W back into a more stable position powerwise. 

Not too sure how its changes are considered a late game nerf, unless that perception is in context of her W multigrab passive, rather than the true damage one. In relation to pre-6.9 Syndra, the W true damage is a pretty shiny upgrade, but for those who care about post 6.9 Syndra, it is a massive drop (and one I'm personally fine with).

Overall, looks like there'd be easier levers to tune up and down as the number of spheres manipulated by the multigrab is ... difficult to work with, to put lightly. Seems like if this doesn't hit the mark exactly (too weak or too strong), it'd be comfortable to revisit her.

With you that even a 10% true damage effect would be at least somewhat appreciable. Far from guaranteed that that's the replacement we go with either at this point. Not guaranteed we replace the W passive upgrade at all either, though I think it's fairly likely we do.

Wouldn't surprise if removing the multigrab W did mean we needed to do some followup adjustments in a later patch too. Agree the multigrab presents from balancing challenges certainly.

>Not guaranteed we replace the W passive upgrade at all either, though I think it's fairly likely we do.

Getting rid of the W passive and replacing it with nothing or a useless passive like the old W is preferable to keeping it. Even if it would make Syndra utter garbage it would fix a core issue. You can always re-balance later no matter what you do, but putting Syndra back towards her roots as a high skill champ has to be priority number one right now.

A 12% true damage boost would be appropriate in my opinion, since then the damage on the new W would be higher until 1100 AP, where the current AP scaling would out scale it. Of course, since this damage is true damage, it will out-damage the current W  after 1100 AP anyways, but the 12% amp would make it so the new W is stronger even in the worst case scenario, where the opponent has 0 MR.

> If removing the existing W passive we'll need another. The old one wasn't impactful or satisfying, so we don't want to go back to that. 

Isn't this new variation of transcended W similar to the old W passive in how boring it is, though? Adding damage is inherently "impactful" but it's hardly "satisfying" for the ability to not play any differently whatsoever. 

In my opinion, the live transcended W is really fun to use well and it makes me look forward to when I can scale it. The transcended W on PBE is just a banal damage buff and completely removes the exciting aspect of the live version.

Of course, this isn't to say the problems with the live version aren't legitimate concerns; however, if you're going to change her kit I'd much prefer the ability's gameplay takes a lateral move even if the power has to decrease for the sake of balance.

Time is an issue though, Syndra cant be left as is and her W NEEDS to be changed, so there simply isn't time to sit around dreaming of a new exciting function for it.
Slapping on some +True Damage is good, for now at least, because it has easy balance leavers, isn't too polarizing, and doesn't over-saturate Syndra's strengths (it's adding CONSISTENT damage instead of BURST damage)

It also gives Riot ways of reducing Syndra's laning power (at least somewhat) while not reducing her overall power too much since they can move power from the base W to the W passive which delays the power until the ability is maxed which will at soonest be level 9 (though I don't really think that is all that needed at the moment anyways)

Forgive me, but wasn't "Established X players don't like that this change makes it easier to do Y combo" something that you guys have said you didn't want to limit or affect balance?  I think it was when Ali combo was made easier that this was brought up.  I think at the time, part of the argument was that the combo was ping reliant though, so not sure if it applies in this case.

The Alistar case was one of ping primarily, not player skill. At extremely low pings it was fairly easy to pull it off consistently. At average+ pings it got substantially less reliable. Given low ping is already such a strong advantage we'll often try and mitigate it in cases like those.

In terms of whether it should be easier or harder to do a thing that depends a lot on the champion in question. Sometimes things are too heavily gated, meaning a champion's average state has to be horrifically weak because of how well they perform when really strong. In those cases improving a champ's skill floor can be a good call. In other cases though a champion's average performance might end up being too strong, or at least too consistent, because a skill test has been removed/reduced that was good for game health and player expression.

Syndra is my favorite and has (probably) been my most played champion for years. I'm very happy with this approach. Thank you.

She suddenly started gaining popularity, and is now disproportionately complained about relative to her actual threat. These complaints always revolve around her ultimate, burst, and its ease of execution. Her ultimate is the last reason I enjoy playing her.

The reason I love Syndra, and the way I play her revolve around her consistent damage. It's also why I like champions like Cassiopeia, even though they play very differently. It's a play-style where you're continuously doing something and it's powerful. For Cassiopeia, the focus of this is purely on damage, while on Syndra, the focus of this is on unmatched control. Both of these feel like a better Karthus with more tools. 

* Q - Good range, potential to be AoE in team-fights, good damage, short cooldown.   
* W - Great range, almost always AoE in team-fights + utility, good damage, reasonably short cooldown: can be used once per skirmish in lane.  
* E - Great ranged utility, AoE, enough damage to kill someone escaping with low HP, reasonably short cooldown, safety from engage. 

With these things, combined with the fact that you can use skills while moving, you are always in control of a situation. Her skills can't be blocked by minions, and q even makes Yasuo's windwall useless. You really have the control-tools of a support champion, with very respectable damage. All three skills work perfectly together. Please never mess with this aspect of her. Her ultimate is what doesn't fit with this control style kit, but it's become her identity, both in terms of burst, her lore, and her lane-wide stun. I (a dedicated Syndra player) wouldn't mind even if the ultimate is replaced. Of course many people would, since they associate Syndra mainly with her ultimate. That's where you dudes make decisions to make everyone happy. This is just my perspective, where I strongly don't want q,w,e changed in terms of range, damage, or cool-down. The changes I'm seeing are actually a buff to how I play her because of the true-damage.

You can successfully get off good damaging ultimates with 15-20% CDR. Do not just randomly place spheres everywhere for the sake of stacking either.

A common combo for picking off the squishies is sphere on top of them, immediately use force of will to stun them, then maybe another q and ult them. You can also throw in your slow in between your last q and ultimate for further damage. That in itself is a five sphere ultimate.
